summary: This is an email chain from October 2021 between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel discussing media inquiries about potential recent activity in the DOJ Office of the Inspector General's investigation into the management of the Metropolitan Correctional Center following Jeffrey Epstein's death. The officials clarify there is an ongoing, slow-moving institutional investigation, but no new investigation has been reopened.

persons.name: Ilan Graff
persons.context: Email recipient who states he will check on any guidance regarding investigative activity into Epstein's death and mentions Nick Roos's recent work.

persons.name: James Margolin
persons.context: Primary email author relaying media inquiries from The New York Times and CBS about recent activity in the DOJ-OIG investigation into Epstein's death and MCC management.

persons.name: Ben
persons.context: Colleague of James Margolin who asked about the investigation so he could keep a pledge not to discuss business during a meeting with Ilan Graff.

persons.name: Nick Roos
persons.context: Cited as having previously rebutted a similar inquiry and provided guidance that the DOJ-OIG investigation into institutional failures is ongoing but not new.

persons.name: Rebekah Donaleski
persons.context: Email recipient copied on the chain discussing the media inquiries about Epstein's death.

persons.name: Nicholas Biase
persons.context: Copied on the email chain discussing media inquiries about Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation; his death in the Metropolitan Correctional Center prompted the DOJ-OIG inquiry.

connections.description: Margolin emails Graff to seek guidance on media inquiries regarding the Epstein investigation.
Margolin references previous communications with Roos about the investigation and seeks his input again.
Margolin states that Ben asked him to inquire about the investigation activity.
Roos provided official guidance on the status of the DOJ-OIG investigation into Epstein's death.

events.title: NY Times Inquiry on Epstein Death Investigation
events.description: The New York Times makes an inquiry about hearing there has been recent activity/interviews in the DOJ-OIG investigation into MCC management related to Epstein's death.

events.title: CBS Inquiry on 'Reopened' Epstein Death Investigation
events.description: CBS contacts the U.S. Attorney's Office based on a source claiming the DOJ has 'reopened' the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.

events.title: DOJ-OIG Investigation into MCC Management
events.description: An ongoing, slow-moving investigation by the DOJ Office of the Inspector General focused on institutional failures at the Metropolitan Correctional Center following Epstein's death.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York (SDNY)
keyFacts: In October 2021, media outlets (NY Times, CBS) were inquiring about recent activity in the DOJ-OIG investigation into the management of the MCC following Jeffrey Epstein's death.
U.S. Attorney's Office officials consistently stated there was an ongoing DOJ-OIG investigation into institutional failures, but it was not new and had been moving slowly since Epstein's death.
Officials explicitly rebutted claims that the investigation into Epstein's death had been 'reopened' as a new investigation.
The email chain reveals internal coordination within the SDNY to manage media inquiries and provide consistent guidance on the sensitive topic.
The document indicates ongoing public and media skepticism or interest in the circumstances of Epstein's death years after the event.
